summary: Tanakh is an acronym that is almost the same thing as saying the "Hebrew Bible."
full_text: The term tzniut  is used within Judaism and has its greatest influence as a concept within Orthodox Judaism and sometimes within Conservative Judaism. It is used to describe both the character trait of modesty and humility, as well as a group of Jewish laws pertaining to conduct in general and especially between the sexes. The term is frequently used with regard to the rules of dress for women.
title: Tzniut
